author: jih2nn
content:
I've opened a PR that rebase Prysm onto Electra and correct IL submission behavior according to the EIP: https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/pull/15088  Please review it when you have some time <@363800010518822915> 

Anyone wants to try it out could use this [Kurtosis config](https://github.com/jihoonsong/local-devnet-focil/blob/main/kurtosis/kurtosis.config.registry.yaml). cc <@993802539856314398>

author: jih2nn
content: One thing I want to share is Geth's `ForkchoiceUpdatedV3` works only when current fork version is Osaka and Kurtosis sets Osaka time only when Fulu fork is set. We're rebasing onto Electra to become independent from Fulu changes so I don't think this is right. I'd like to suggest to use eip7805 for the EL as well and want to discuss this in the upcoming FOCIL breakout. I temporarily made Geth's `ForkchoiceUpdatedV3` don't check fork version for testing purpose and it's available at `jihoonsg/geth-focil:no-osaka`.

author: jih2nn
content:
Now that we can run both Lodestar and Prysm on Electra (and maybe Lighthouse, too? I haven't check it), we can test CLs interop using config like this:
```
participants_matrix:
  el:
    - el_type: geth
      el_image: jihoonsg/geth-focil:no-osaka
  cl:
    - cl_type: lodestar
      cl_image: lodestar-focil:latest
    - cl_type: prysm
      cl_image: prysm-beacon-chain-focil:latest
      vc_image: prysm-validator-focil:latest
network_params:
  genesis_delay: 20
  electra_fork_epoch: 0
  eip7805_fork_epoch: 1
  num_validator_keys_per_node: 256
```

Still we got state root mistach error like this though:
```
[cl-2-prysm-geth] time="2025-03-23 12:06:45" level=debug msg="Could not process block" error="failed to validate consensus state transition function: could not execute state transition: could not validate state root, wanted: 0xd5d11eee4d817b9e3a99fe33b5ee063ae7ff056ce73dbfa807d623e733951a48, received: 0xdcf839577585b35381f60d8cc38954ad3bed4e976eb2fc5d730ad68b6fbf113b" prefix=sync slot=34
```
